title: 'Maduro, wife captured': Trump says Venezuela leader 'flown out of country'; what he said
content: Former US President Donald Trump announced a "large scale strike" against Venezuela, claiming President Nicol√°s Maduro and his wife have been captured. This follows a series of explosions in Caracas, with low-flying aircraft and power outages reported. The FAA banned US commercial flights in Venezuelan airspace due to "ongoing military activity."

title: 'Criminal military aggression': Venezuela govt after US attack‚Äîwhat we know
content: Venezuela accuses the US of attacking civilian and military sites, prompting President Maduro to declare a state of emergency and call for mass mobilization. US officials confirmed President Trump ordered strikes on Venezuelan military facilities, escalating a campaign against the Maduro government amid a regional military buildup and recent seizures of oil tankers.

title: China's DeepSeek returns: Proves cheaper AI works again; Silicon Valley shaken
content: Chinese AI firm DeepSeek unveiled a groundbreaking training method, "Manifold-Constrained Hyper-Connections," potentially slashing AI development costs. This innovation challenges the notion that advanced AI necessitates massive computing power, following their previous success with the R1 model. The breakthrough intensifies industry debates on scaling AI, with expectations high for DeepSeek's next model release.

title: ‚ÄòMindless politicising of sport‚Äô: Tharoor slams Mustafizur Rahman‚Äôs IPL exit
content: Sharing a video from Friday, Tharoor made his position clear on the issue. "Recalling my views on the subject, now that BCCI has deplorably pulled the plug on Mustafizur Rahman," he said. He then questioned the logic behind the move, adding: "And what if the Bangladeshi player in question had been Litton Das or Soumya Sarkar?"

title: CUET UG 2026 registration begins: Direct link to apply and other details here
content: The National Testing Agency (NTA) has commenced the online registration for CUET UG 2026, offering admission to undergraduate programs across India. The application window is open until January 30, 2026, with the exam scheduled between May 11 and May 31, 2026. Candidates are urged to carefully review the Information Bulletin for detailed instructions.

title: Power check 2026: Top politicians in focus this year
content: The year 2026 is set to be a pivotal electoral year, featuring crucial assembly elections in West Bengal, Tamil Nadu, Kerala, Assam, and Puducherry. These contests will significantly shape the careers of key leaders and test the national ambitions of major parties, influencing the landscape leading up to the 2029 Lok Sabha elections.

title: Aadhaar in America? US billionaire backs universal digital identity; Musk pushes voter ID laws
content: Silicon Valley investor Vinod Khosla echoes Elon Musk's call for a universal US digital ID, inspired by India's Aadhaar. Khosla believes such a system, while opt-in, would enhance convenience and reduce fraud, similar to Aadhaar's success. This aligns with Musk's push for voter ID laws, prompted by concerns over election integrity ahead of the 2026 midterms.

title: No IPL for Mustafizur! 'Hindu or Muslim comes later': Rinku Singh's coach reacts
content: Masood Uz Zafar Amini, the coach of Indian batter Rinku Singh, has shared his views on the BCCI‚Äôs decision to release Bangladesh fast bowler Mustafizur Rahman from the 2026 Indian Premier League season. Amini said that while opinions may differ, the decision taken by the BCCI must be respected by everyone.

title: OpenAI hunts team head: Sam Altman flags 'stressful' role; leadership post for 2024 unit opens
content: OpenAI is actively seeking a 'head of preparedness' to lead its newly formed Safety Systems team. This critical role will focus on core Preparedness research, ensuring the responsible development and deployment of advanced AI models. The position is described as 'stressful' and requires navigating complex challenges in cybersecurity, biological capabilities, and self-improving systems.

title: Govt proposes Aadhaar-like ID for EV batteries; aims to boost traceability, recycling
content: The government is proposing a unique 21-character "Battery Pack Aadhaar Number" (BPAN) for electric vehicle batteries. This initiative aims to ensure complete traceability from raw materials to recycling, enhancing transparency and sustainability in the battery ecosystem. The system will track battery performance and environmental impact, facilitating second-life usage and efficient recycling processes.

title: US strikes Venezuela: Maduro captured by US special forces; unit led al-Baghdadi killing
content: US special forces  captured Venezuelan President Nicolas Maduro and his wife.  President Donald Trump confirmed a large-scale strike against Venezuela and its leader.  The elite Delta Force unit conducted the operation.  Explosions were heard across the capital, Caracas, with power outages reported.  Venezuelan authorities are demanding proof of life.

title: Another Hindu dies in Bangladesh: Khokon Das succumbs to injuries 3 days after being set on fire
content: A Hindu businessman, Khokon Das, succumbed to his injuries after being attacked with sharp weapons and set ablaze in Bangladesh. Das was waylaid, beaten, and doused with petrol before being set on fire. This incident is part of a disturbing trend of violence targeting the Hindu community in Bangladesh.

title: Budget 2026: Rice exporters seek support to boost sustainability, global competitiveness
content: The Indian Rice Exporters‚Äô Federation (IREF) urges the Union government to implement targeted fiscal and policy measures in the 2026 budget to bolster India's rice export ecosystem. Key demands include incentives for water-saving farming, support for premium rice varieties, and improved logistics and export finance to enhance competitiveness and farmer returns.

title: No Mustafizur for KKR! IPL side confirms release of Bangladesh pacer
content: Kolkata Knight Riders have confirmed that Bangladeshi fast bowler Mustafizur Rahman has been released from their IPL squad following instructions from the BCCI. The decision came amid political and public controversy after his signing at the auction. KKR will be allowed to name a replacement player. Despite the turmoil off the pitch, Mustafizur continues to perform well in the Bangladesh Premier League.

title: Himachal student dies after 'sexual harassment', ragging; FIR against professor, 3 pupils
content: A Himachal Pradesh college professor and three students face charges of sexual harassment and ragging following the death of a 19-year-old student. The victim had accused them of mistreatment, which her father claims led to her depression and eventual death. Police are investigating the cause of death and verifying all allegations.

title: Tamil Nadu elections: Stalin launches DMK manifesto portal 2026
content: Tamil Nadu CM and DMK president MK Stalin launched the DMK Election Manifesto Portal 2026 in Chennai, inviting people from all sections of society to submit suggestions for the party‚Äôs assembly election manifesto. MP Kanimozhi Karunanidhi said the initiative aims to create a ‚Äúpeople‚Äôs manifesto‚Äù and highlighted the DMK‚Äôs record of fulfilling its promises.

title: 'Ikkis' box office collection day 3 (Live)
content: Agastya Nanda's debut film 'Ikkis' is making waves at the box office. The war drama has surpassed the earnings of 'Tu Meri Main Tera Main Tera Tu Meri'. However, 'Ikkis' is facing stiff competition from 'Dhurandhar'. The film is based on the real-life story of Arun Khetrapal.

title: Cigarettes to get expensive from Feb 1! How much more will you pay? Check list
content: Get ready for pricier smokes! Starting February 1st, cigarette prices are set to climb due to a new excise duty hike and a 40% GST on tobacco. This move aims to align taxes with public health impacts and international standards, making cigarettes noticeably more expensive across various lengths.

title: Hardik Pandya goes berserk: Five sixes and a four in a single over to reach ton - Watch
content: Hardik Pandya delivered a remarkable performance in the Vijay Hazare Trophy. He scored a brilliant century for Baroda against Vidarbha. Pandya took control of the innings when his team was struggling. His powerful hitting included a remarkable over where he hit five sixes. Pandya's innings ensured Baroda posted a strong total. The Vidarbha bowlers found him difficult to contain.

title: 'Bihari girls available for marriage for Rs 25k': U'khand minister's husband sparks row
content: Uttarakhand minister Rekha Arya's husband sparked outrage with a remark suggesting Bihari girls are available for weddings at low prices. Political parties across Bihar condemned the statement, with the Bihar State Women Commission issuing a notice. Leaders demanded an apology and action against him.

title: Why Indian professionals are earning the most in Germany‚Äôs job market
content: Indian professionals working full-time in Germany earn the highest median salaries among all nationalities, not due to origin but occupation, a study by the German Economic Institute shows. Concentrated in high-paying STEM and research roles, Indians fill critical skill gaps in Germany‚Äôs ageing economy, underscoring how specialised expertise‚Äînot nationality‚Äîdrives wages and innovation.

title: Tension in West Bengal: Mob attacks police for arresting TMC worker in Sandeshkhali
content: Six police personnel were injured in Sandeshkhali, West Bengal, after a mob attacked them during the arrest of TMC activist Musa Mollah. Villagers allegedly pelted stones and vandalized a police vehicle. Two local TMC leaders were also detained for allegedly instigating the violence.

title: Chhattisgarh encounter: Over 12 Maoists killed in Sukma, 2 in Bijapur
content: Security forces have eliminated 14 Maoists in separate encounters in Chhattisgarh's Sukma and Bijapur districts. The anti-insurgency operation, which began early Saturday, resulted in the recovery of bodies and a significant cache of weapons. Police sources indicated that commanders allegedly involved in the killing of Konta ASP Akash Rao Girepunje have been neutralized.

title: Amid IPL participation row, Mustafizur posts: 'Always grateful'
content: Bangladesh fast bowler Mustafizur Rahman has found himself at the centre of attention, both for his cricketing milestone and a growing controversy around his IPL participation. Amid the ongoing debate, Mustafizur took to social media to celebrate a personal achievement and his recent performance in the Bangladesh Premier League (BPL).

title: ‚ÄòThey would kill me‚Äô: Student‚Äôs father claims bottle attack in Himachal 'sexual harassment' case
content: A 19-year-old student who alleged sexual harassment and ragging died in a Ludhiana hospital. An FIR has been filed against a professor and three female students at Govt College, Dharamshala, for their alleged involvement in the incident. Authorities are investigating the cause of death and verifying all allegations.

title: Drunk man climbs Tirupati temple tower, tries to vandalise Kalasams
content: A drunk man gained unauthorized access to Tirupati's Sri Govindaraja Swamy temple and attempted to damage its Gopuram, highlighting significant security vulnerabilities. The incident, which occurred late Friday night, led to the man's apprehension after a three-hour operation by police and fire services, prompting criticism over repeated security lapses.

title: Rupee in 2026: After 5% fall in 2025, where is the currency headed?
content: The Indian Rupee experienced a significant decline in 2025, falling nearly 5% against the US dollar. However, SBI predicts a turnaround in 2026, with the currency expected to strengthen due to favorable global conditions, potential capital inflows, and India's stable economic outlook.

title: NCERT to be granted deemed university status: Here is what that changes
content: NCERT, known for school textbooks, is poised to become a deemed-to-be-university by January's end. This move, supported by the Ministry of Education and awaiting UGC approval, will grant it academic autonomy to award degrees and conduct postgraduate research. The transformation aligns with the National Education Policy, enhancing its role in global academic collaboration and higher education.

title: 'No mistake of SRK': Maulana Sajid backs Shah Rukh amid Mustafizur Rahman row
content: Maulana Sajid Rashidi backs Shah Rukh Khan.  The All India Imam Association president stated the BCCI directive to remove Mustafizur Rahman from KKR should have come before the auction.  He believes the decision is politically motivated.  The BCCI asked KKR to release the Bangladeshi pacer for the 2026 IPL season.  A replacement will be permitted.

title: Who is Badse Deva alias Sukka? Most battle-hardened Maoist commander surrenders
content: A key People's Liberation Guerrilla Army battalion commander, Badse Deva alias Sukka, a close associate of Madvi Hidma, surrendered to Telangana police with several others. Deva, who carried significant rewards, was described as a battle-hardened commander linked to major Maoist attacks in central India.

title: 'Dhurandhar' BO collection day 30: Ranveer Singh starrer aims to cross Rs 750 cr mark
content: Ranveer Singh's 'Dhurandhar' continues its reign, nearing ‚Çπ750 crore on its 30th day. Meanwhile, Kartik Aaryan and Ananya Panday's 'Tu Meri Main Tera Main Tera Tu Meri' struggles, barely crossing ‚Çπ30 crore by its 10th day. The stark contrast highlights 'Dhurandhar's' immense box office dominance against newer releases.

title: 1 in 6 happy couples keep a backup partner: What it reveals about modern dating?
content: A recent survey found 16% of adults in committed relationships keep a "backup partner" in mind, with men more likely than women. This "what if" thinking often signals unmet needs for playfulness and passion within the current relationship. Experts suggest using these fantasies to reignite existing bonds through honesty and excitement.

title: Nagpur parents go to work, chain 12-yr-old 'habitual thief' at home
content: A 12-year-old boy in Nagpur was rescued after being chained and locked by his parents for hours daily over two months due to alleged cellphone theft. The school dropout, showing injuries from restraints and signs of trauma, has been moved to a government home for children. Police are investigating the incident.

title: Defaced, Indore‚Äôs ‚Äòcleanest‚Äô tag drowning? Officials point ‚Äòdirty‚Äô fingers at each other
content: Following a deadly diarrhea outbreak in Indore's Bhagirathpura area, elected representatives and officials are locked in a blame game over responsibility. The tragedy has exposed serious lapses within the BJP-led civic body, leading to the suspension of key officials, including the IMC commissioner, after the Chief Minister intervened.

title: Dhurandhar: No I&B ministry order to mute 'Baloch' in Ranveer Singh-starrer; what officials said
content: In a surprising turn of events, officials have now confirmed that the recent alterations to Aditya Dhar's film 'Dhurandhar', which include muted dialogues, were entirely the choice of the filmmakers. These modifications were implemented in accordance with the Cinematograph Act, rather than due to any government intervention. Read on to know more.

title: Caught on cam: Thief prays, hesitates for 15 seconds, then steals donation box at temple
content: A young man was captured on CCTV stealing a donation box from a temple in Lucknow, but not before displaying remarkable devotion. The thief was seen praying to Lord Hanuman, carefully moving offerings, and even walking backward to avoid disrespecting the deity. Police are analyzing the footage to identify the suspect, who may be a minor.

title: Maharashtra civic polls: 39 Mahayuti candidates win unopposed across 4 bodies
content: A significant number of unopposed victories, totaling 39 across four civic bodies near Mumbai, have sparked opposition allegations of bias and coercion. The State Election Commission will investigate these claims, particularly concerning withdrawals favouring BJP and Shinde Sena candidates. This early advantage for the ruling alliance has drawn criticism from various parties.

title: Bank holiday on Hazrat Ali: Where are banks closed on January 3? Check list
content: As 2026 begins, Indian banks will observe numerous national and state-specific holidays, impacting branch operations. Customers should consult the bank holiday calendar to avoid disruptions for in-branch transactions, though digital services remain accessible. Key closures include January 3rd for Hazrat Ali's birthday in Uttar Pradesh and January 26th for Republic Day nationwide.

title: FCS national championship preview: Illinois State, Montana State starving for title
content: NDSU came within 37 seconds of a national title in 2014 . the Bobcats came up three points short of the title . they're the first team to win four road games in a single playoff run . it's their first title game since the 2014 heartbreath of FCS .

title: Claressa Shields, Gabriela Fundora, Amanda Serrano and more
content: women's boxing continued its rapid growth in 2025 . new faces have emerged, while several fighters have fallen out altogether . the year featured historic milestones, including multiple undisputed champions . a thrilling conclusion to the Katie Taylor-Amanda Serrano trilogy and Claressa Shields unifying all four heavyweight titles .

title: The Playbook: Shadow Reports, lineup locks and projected scores for Week 18
content: the playbook for week 18 kicks off with a pair of games with playoff implications . this column features score projections, over/unders, win probabilities, and easy digestible fantasy advice for seasonlong leagues and DFS .

title: Bold MLB predictions for 2026: The World Series champion Orioles? A Skubal blockbuster?
content: we asked our experts to give their boldest predictions for what the new year will bring . a look into the crystal ball for the topics that will have us all talking in 2026 . the Baltimore Orioles finished last in the AL East in 2025, but their 75 wins were the most .

title: Olympic hockey roster grades for U.S., Canada, Finland, Sweden, plus snubs and surprises
content: the 2026 winter Olympic men's hockey tournament begins febr. 12 in Milan, Italy . the tournament promises to have some great games, battles for medals and of course the potential for another round in the USA vs. Canada rivalry . before the teams hit the ice, they needed to officially lock in their rosters .

title: The psychology behind fraud: Why people fall prey despite knowing better
content: Representative AI image Red flags may still be visible, but the brain temporarily ignores them because emotional safety feels more urgent than accuracy. This is why scams often target people during vulnerable moments ‚Äî late at night, after a loss, or during financial uncertainty. Emotional stress such as fear of loss, financial pressure, or loneliness activates the limbic system, particularly the amygdala, which prioritizes emotional survival responses over careful analysis.

title: College football transfer portal: Tracking who's on the move
content: Max Olson ranks Cincinnati's Brendan Sorsby as the top player in the transfer portal and predicts a recruitment battle between Texas Tech and LSU. (1:04) College football's transfer portal officially opened at midnight ET on Jan. 2. However, players have been announcing their intentions to transfer since the regular season ended. By midday on Day 1, more than 4,500 Division I college football players have entered the transfer portal. Players now have until Jan. 16 to enter their name to transfer. It doesn't mean they have to find their new schools by then -- or that they can't return to their previous schools. We are tracking the notable players entering the portal as well as those players who will re-sign with their current schools. Here's the latest news and updates on how the 2026 season could be transformed.

title: Our guide to every Week 18 game: Matchup previews, predictions and more
content: the week 18 NFL schedule brings some exciting matchups to wrap up the 2025 regular season . Carolina-Tampa Bay and Baltimore-Pittsburgh are winner-take-all games for the final spots in the playoffs . the seahawks and 49ers will duel for the no. 1 seed in the NFC .

title: Big 12 Bracketology preview: NCAA tournament predictions for every team
content: the big 12 has a realistic shot to regain its crown in 2025-26 . two of the projected no. 1 seeds have raced to their lofty perch with a combined 26-0 record . AJ Dybantsa is predictedably dangerous, leaving preseason no.1 Houston as an under the radar national title contender .

title: Ravens vs. Steelers: Answering six questions ahead of Sunday's AFC North showdown
content: the Baltimore Ravens beat the Pittsburgh Steelers 13-6 on saturday night . the Ravens and the Steelers will battle for the AFC North crown on sunday . they will play in the final regular-season game of the 2025 season .

title: CFP quarterfinal takeaways: Ole Miss' wild upset, Indiana's dominance and more
content: the second edition of the college football playoff quarterfinals gave us two classics and two statement wins . on Wednesday, no. 10 Miami rode an early 14-0 burst and a clutch late touchdown drive to a 24-14 upset of no. 2 Ohio State . the Hurricanes advanced to the semis to face no. 6 Ole Miss .
